intro: Spiesia confusa, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in umbellate structures. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating. Spiesia confusa is typically found in grasslands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
